catalog_info.title: Poverty and Development in Latin America
catalog_info.description: This course explores how development theories and practices have shaped history, politics, and the dynamics of everyday life in Latin America. We consider Latin America’s colonial legacy, the effects of modernization and dependency theories, and ideals of democratic development. Coupling in-depth ethnographies with readings from development theorists, topics we cover include: systemic inequality, citizenship, indigenous rights, environmentalism, healthcare, microcredit, state violence and insecurity.
